Title: Trainee Data Science / AI engineer (d/f/m/x)
Description:
Life is always about becoming… Becoming means going on a journey to be the best version of our future selves. While we discover new things, we will face challenges, master them and grow beyond our individual limits.

Apply for a job at Mercedes-Benz and find your individual role and workspace to unleash your talents to the fullest. Empowered by visionary colleagues who share the same pioneering spirit. Joining us means becoming part of a global team that aims to build the most desirable cars in the world. Together for excellence.

Job-ID: MER0003VTG

Aufgaben

Do you want to unlock your full potential and help shape the transformation at Mercedes-Benz? Then our international graduate program “Inspire – Your Journey of Growth” offers a unique opportunity to contribute, learn, and grow.

We are looking for ambitious graduates and early professionals who are open and willing to take on new perspectives and drive the change.

Shape Your Individual Journey Of Growth


The program will start July 1st, 2026
During your 14-month trainee program you work on exciting projects at home and abroad, tailored to your profile and career goals
A top-level mentor will accompany you throughout the program, offering guidance for your professional development and helping you build a strong network for your future career
Participate in our training camps where you reflect on your strengths and unlock your full potential
Bring your pioneering spirit to current business projects: We combine your perspective and your ideas with our innovative product development to create the world's most desirable cars


Welcome to the world of Tech4People (T4P) – where HR and IT merge to drive the digital transformation of HR and to manage, standardize, and optimize the global HR IT portfolio. Our values and principles are clear: We lead the way and shape the future. True to our purpose "we unleash the power of tech, to let people do more with less". As an Inspire Trainee in the Data Scientist or AI Engineer field within T4P, you will work at this interface between Human Resources and Information Technology with a strong focus on AI. Your role involves significantly shaping HR's digital transformation by developing, implementing, and coordinating Data Science and AI projects. You'll delve into HR processes, understanding HR's business needs and the data they generate - from talent acquisition to employee retention. Utilizing data from various sources, you will develop value-adding digital solutions, including predictive models for, e.g., talent retention, personalized learning paths, and tools to optimize employee experience and to automate HR processes. You will be key in connecting HR experts with data insights, leading international (sub-)projects, and independently developing innovative AI and advanced data science solutions for HR.

Profil


An above-average degree (master, MBA or doctorate) in Data Science, AI or Software Engineering, Business Administration, Economics, Information Technology, Business Informatics or comparable course of study
Maximum of 3 years of professional experience (apart from studies) 
At least 3 months of experience abroad (study, international internship, work and travel) 
Strong affinity for digital technologies and enthusiasm for future trends  
We value applicants who show a strong sense of social responsibility
Excellent English and German skills (C1)
You are eager to shape the transformation at Mercedes-Benz and take responsibility
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, coupled with exceptional analytical abilities
You demonstrate strong teamwork skills who motivates others to achieve their goals


We are looking forward to your application. We have a multi-stage recruiting process: If you successfully pass our Online Assessment and a short video interview, we will invite you to our Inspire Day at the end of March 2026 in Stuttgart, Germany.  

If you would like to get more information about our new Inspire program, have a look at our career website: Mercedes-Benz Career Website. You will find further open graduate positions under the #inspire-journey.

We particularly welcome online applications from candidates with disabilities or similar impairments in direct response to this job advertisement. If you have any questions, you can contact the local disability officer once you have submitted your application form, who will gladly assist you in the onward application process: sbv-zentrale@mercedes-benz.com.

Wir bieten


Coaching
Hybrid Work Possible
Discounts for Employees Possible
Health Benefits
Mobility Offers
Mobile Phone for Employees Possible
Events for Employees
Meal-Discounts
Annual Profit Share Possible
Company Retirement
Flextime Possible
Lifelong Learning
Parking
Near-Site Childcare
Canteen, Café
Good Public Transport
Barrier-Free Workplace
Inhouse Doctor


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Trainee Data Science / KI-Ingenieur (d/m/w/x)
Description:
Life is always about becoming… Im Leben geht es darum, sich auf eine Reise zu begeben, um die beste Version unseres zukünftigen Selbst zu werden. Während wir Neues entdecken, stellen wir uns Herausforderungen, meistern sie und wachsen über uns hinaus.

Bewerben Sie sich bei Mercedes-Benz und finden Sie den Aufgabenbereich, in dem Sie Ihre Talente individuell entfalten können. Dabei werden Sie von visionären Kolleginnen und Kollegen unterstützt, die Ihren Pioniergeist teilen. Bei uns einzusteigen bedeutet, Teil eines globalen Teams zu werden, dessen Ziel es ist, die begehrenswertesten Automobile der Welt zu bauen. Together for excellence.

Stellennummer: MER0003VTG

Aufgaben

Hast Du Lust Dein volles Potenzial zu entfalten und die Transformation bei Mercedes-Benz mitzugestalten? Dann bietet Dir unser internationales Nachwuchsprogramm „Inspire – Your Journey of Growth“ eine einzigartige Gelegenheit, Dich einzubringen, zu lernen und zu wachsen.

Wir suchen ambitionierte Absolvierende und Berufseinsteigende, die motiviert und bereit sind, neue Perspektiven einzunehmen und den Wandel voranzutreiben.

Gestalte Deine Individuelle Journey Of Growth


Das Programm startet am 01. Juli 2026
Während Deines 14-monatigen Traineeprogramms arbeitest Du an spannenden Projekten im In- und Ausland, maßgeschneidert auf Dein Profil und Deine Karriereziele
Ein Top-Level-Mentor begleitet Dich während des gesamten Programms, bietet Dir Orientierung für Deine berufliche Entwicklung und hilft Dir, ein starkes Netzwerk für Deine zukünftige Karriere aufzubauen
Du nimmst teil an unseren Trainingscamps, in denen Du Deine Stärken reflektierst und Dein volles Potenzial entfaltest
Du bringst Deinen Pioniergeist in aktuelle Geschäftsprojekte ein: Wir verbinden Deine Perspektive und Deine Ideen mit unserer innovativen Produktentwicklung, um die begehrenswertesten Autos der Welt zu schaffen


Willkommen in der Welt von Tech4People (T4P) – dort, wo HR und IT zusammenkommen, um die digitale Transformation des Personalwesens voranzutreiben sowie das globale HR-IT-Portfolio zu managen, zu standardisieren und zu optimieren. Unsere Werte und Prinzipien sind klar: Wir gehen voran und gestalten die Zukunft – ganz nach unserem Leitgedanken: „Wir entfesseln die Kraft der Technologie, damit Menschen mehr mit weniger erreichen können.“ Als Inspire Trainee im Bereich Data Scientist oder AI Engineer bei T4P arbeitest Du an der Schnittstelle zwischen Human Resources und Informationstechnologie, mit einem starken Fokus auf künstliche Intelligenz.

In Deiner Rolle gestaltest Du die digitale Transformation von HR aktiv mit, indem Du Data-Science- und KI-Projekte entwickelst, implementierst und koordinierst. Du tauchst tief in HR-Prozesse ein, verstehst die geschäftlichen Anforderungen von HR sowie die Daten, die dabei entstehen – von Talent Acquisition bis hin zur Mitarbeiterbindung. Unter Nutzung von Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen entwickelst Du wertschöpfende digitale Lösungen, darunter prädiktive Modelle für z. B. Mitarbeiterbindung, personalisierte Lernpfade und Tools zur Optimierung der Employee Experience sowie zur Automatisierung von HR-Prozessen. Du spielst eine zentrale Rolle dabei, HR-Expert*innen mit datengestützten Erkenntnissen zu vernetzen, internationale (Teil-)Projekte zu leiten und eigenständig innovative KI- und fortgeschrittene Data-Science-Lösungen für HR zu entwickeln.

Profil


Überdurchschnittlicher Hochschulabschluss (Master, MBA oder Promotion) in Data Science, KI oder Software Engineering, Betriebswirtschaft, Volkswirtschaft, Informationstechnologie, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einem vergleichbaren Studiengang
Maximal drei Jahre Berufserfahrung (außerhalb des Studiums)
Mindestens drei Monate Auslandserfahrung (z. B. durch Studium, internationales Praktikum oder Work & Travel)
Starke Affinität zu digitalen Technologien und Begeisterung für Zukunftstrends
Bewerberinnen und Bewerber mit einem ausgeprägten sozialen Verantwortungsbewusstsein werden geschätzt
Exzellente Englischkenntnisse (Niveau C1) und Deutschkenntnisse (C1)
Motivation, die Transformation bei Mercedes-Benz aktiv mitzugestalten und Verantwortung zu übernehmen
Ausgeprägte zwischenmenschliche und kommunikative Fähigkeiten in Kombination mit hervorragender analytischer Kompetenz
Teamorientierte Persönlichkeit, die andere motiviert, gemeinsame Ziele zu erreichen


Wir freuen uns auf Deine Online-Bewerbung. Unser Recruiting-Prozess ist mehrstufig aufgebaut: Nach erfolgreichem Absolvieren unseres Online Assessment und einem kurzen Videointerview, laden wir Dich Ende März 2026 zu unserem Inspire Day nach Stuttgart ein.

Wenn Du weitere Informationen zu unserem Inspire-Programm erhalten möchtest, schau auf unserer Karriereseite vorbei: Mercedes-Benz Career Website. Weitere offene Absolventenpositionen findest Du unter dem Hashtag #inspire-journey.

Wir freuen uns insbesondere über Online-Bewerbungen von Kandidat*innen mit Behinderungen oder gleichgestellten Beeinträchtigungen. Unsere Schwerbehindertenvertretung (sbv-zentrale@mercedes-benz.com) unterstützt Dich gerne im Bewerbungsprozess.

Wir bieten


Coaching
Hybrides Arbeiten möglich
Mit­arbeiter­rabatte möglich
Gesund­heits­maß­nahmen
Mobilitäts­angebote
Mit­arbeiter­handy möglich
Mit­arbeiter Events
Essens­zulagen
Mit­arbeiter­beteili­gung möglich
Betrieb­liche Alters­ver­sorgung
Flexible Arbeits­zeit möglich
Lebens­langes Lernen
Park­platz
Kinder­betreuung
Kantine, Café
Gute An­bindung
Barriere­frei­heit
Betriebs­arzt


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: Machine Learning Software Engineer
Description:
About Applied Intuition

Applied Intuition is the vehicle intelligence company that accelerates the global adoption of safe, AI-driven machines. Founded in 2017 and now valued at $15 billion following its recent Series F funding round, Applied Intuition delivers the Vehicle OS, Self-Driving System, and toolchain to help customers build intelligent vehicles and shorten time to market. 18 of the top 20 global automakers and major programs across the Department of Defense trust Applied Intuition's solutions to deliver vehicle intelligence. Applied Intuition services the automotive, defense, trucking, construction, mining, and agriculture industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Washington, D.C., San Diego, CA, Ft. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor, MI, London, Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Bangalore, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at applied.co.

We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments.

About The Role

We are looking for software engineers with expertise in ML-first perception, prediction or planning for autonomous vehicles or mobile robots. Your contributions will focus on building out key ML capabilities of an autonomous vehicle stack.

In addition to your engineering contributions, by working in our dynamic and customer-focused team culture, you will contribute to and learn from best practices in the autonomy industry. We move fast and focus on excellence, for our products and for our business. If you are hands-on and looking for a place to have a multiplying effect on making autonomous systems a reality, Applied Intuition is the place for you!

At Applied Intuition, you will:


Design and implement capabilities and workflows for cutting-edge real-world perception or planning/prediction systems
Leverage established products at Applied Intuition to build the software and infrastructure foundation for our ML developments


We're looking for someone who has:


Experience with the end-to-end development cycle of deep learning models
Expertise in subdomains such as modeling, input pipelines, evaluation, deployment, and model optimization
3+ years of experience building production software using modern software practices
Fluency in C++, or fluency in Python with intermediate experience in C++
Deep understanding of the concepts and methods behind any frameworks or libraries that they worked with
Experience working with production level ML and DL perception algorithms for autonomous vehicles


Nice to have:


MSc or PhD in machine learning, ideally applied to perception, prediction,planning or closely related field
Experience building and shipping software frameworks or tools
Experience with driver assistance or autonomous driving systems
Experience in evaluating and improving system-in-the-loop model performance
Deep hands-on expertise in relevant algorithms or methods, such as non-linear optimization, computational geometry, numerical analysis, or distributed systems


Benefits and perks


Lunch and dinner allowance
Fitness (600 USD) and learning stipends (1,000 USD) annually
Stock options


Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Applied Intuition is an equal opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor. Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.

About Applied Intuition

Applied Intuition is the vehicle intelligence company that accelerates the global adoption of safe, AI-driven machines. Founded in 2017 and now valued at $15 billion following its recent Series F funding round, Applied Intuition delivers the Vehicle OS, Self-Driving System, and toolchain to help customers build intelligent vehicles and shorten time to market. 18 of the top 20 global automakers and major programs across the Department of Defense trust Applied Intuition's solutions to deliver vehicle intelligence. Walton Beach, FL, Ann Arbor, MI, London, Stuttgart, Munich, Stockholm, Bangalore, Seoul, and Tokyo. Learn more at applied.co.

We are an in-office company, and our expectation is that employees primarily work from their Applied Intuition office 5 days a week. However, we also recognize the importance of flexibility and trust our employees to manage their schedules responsibly. This may include occasional remote work, starting the day with morning meetings from home before heading to the office, or leaving earlier when needed to accommodate family commitments.

In addition to your engineering contributions, by working in our dynamic and customer-focused team culture, you will contribute to and learn from best practices in the autonomy industry. We move fast and focus on excellence, for our products and for our business. If you are hands-on and looking for a place to have a multiplying effect on making autonomous systems a reality, Applied Intuition is the place for you!

  • Design and implement capabilities and workflows for cutting-edge real-world perception or planning/prediction systems
  • Leverage established products at Applied Intuition to build the software and infrastructure foundation for our ML developments

We're looking for someone who has:

  • Experience with the end-to-end development cycle of deep learning models
  • Expertise in subdomains such as modeling, input pipelines, evaluation, deployment, and model optimization
  • 3+ years of experience building production software using modern software practices
  • Fluency in C++, or fluency in Python with intermediate experience in C++
  • Deep understanding of the concepts and methods behind any frameworks or libraries that they worked with
  • Experience working with production level ML and DL perception algorithms for autonomous vehicles

Nice to have:

  • MSc or PhD in machine learning, ideally applied to perception, prediction,planning or closely related field
  • Experience building and shipping software frameworks or tools
  • Experience with driver assistance or autonomous driving systems
  • Experience in evaluating and improving system-in-the-loop model performance
  • Deep hands-on expertise in relevant algorithms or methods, such as non-linear optimization, computational geometry, numerical analysis, or distributed systems

Benefits and perks

  • Lunch and dinner allowance
  • Fitness (600 USD) and learning stipends (1,000 USD) annually
  • Stock options

Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Consequently, the parties agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of 41 CFR 60-1.4(a), 41 CFR 60-300.5(a) and 41 CFR 60-741.5(a) and that these laws are incorporated herein by reference. These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or national origin. These regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status or disability. The parties also agree that, as applicable, they will abide by the requirements of Executive Order 13496 (29 CFR Part 471, Appendix A to Subpart A), relating to the notice of employee rights under federal labor laws.
